page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: GENERAL REVIEW Ruskington has a population of almost 4000 people which gives it the status of a small town. The last thirty years has seen a steady growth in house building - unusual for a rural village. There are two reasons for this; the local town of Sleaford has been slow to release building land, the Royal Air Force have three large bases adjacent and personnel from these require accommodation. Both Ruskington and Dorrington are situated on the fringe of Lincolnshire's Fenland,the surrounding area being flat and intensely farmed. Characteristically, the farmland is interlaced with man- made ditches to assist drainage.{In {the original Domesday Book, Ruskington {is featured as Reschintone.}
